com.teamboid.twitterapi.status

Interface Status


  • public interface Status
    Represents a Tweet on Twitter.
    Author:
    Aidan Follestad

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Calendar getCreatedAt()
      Gets the date and time the tweet was composed.
      HashtagEntity[] getHashtagEntities()
      Gets the hashtag entities contained in a Tweet; Hashtag entities are useful for extracting hashtags without using methods like regular expressions.
      long getId()
      Gets the ID of the tweet.
      java.lang.String getInReplyToScreenName()
      Gets the screen name of the user that created the tweet that this tweet is in reply to.
      long getInReplyToStatusId()
      Gets the ID of the status that this tweet is in reply to (if any).
      long getInReplyToUserId()
      Gets the ID of the user that created the tweet that this tweet is in reply to.
      MediaEntity[] getMediaEntities()
      Gets the URL entities contained in a Tweet; Media entities are useful for extracting the images held in a tweet.
      MentionEntity[] getMentionEntities()
      Gets the mention entities contained in a Tweet; Mention entities are useful for extracting mentions without using methods like regular expressions.
      long getRetweetCount()
      Gets the number of times this tweet has been retweeted by other users.
      java.lang.String getSource()
      Gets the application that was used to create the Tweet.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Gets the main content contained in the tweet, will be 140 characters or less.
      UrlEntity[] getUrlEntities()
      Gets the URL entities contained in the Tweet; URL entities are useful for expanding t.co URLs.
      User getUser()
      Gets the User object of the user that created the tweet.
      boolean isFavorited()
      Gets whether or not the authenticated user has favorited this tweet.
      boolean isRetweeted()
      Gets whether or not the authenticated user has retweeted this tweet.
      boolean isTruncated()
      Gets whether or not the Tweet has been truncated.
      void setFavorited(boolean isFavorited)
      This does not actually favorite the Tweet on Twitter, this function is used in the library.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        long getId()
        Gets the ID of the tweet.

      • isFavorited

        boolean isFavorited()
        Gets whether or not the authenticated user has favorited this tweet.
        Returns:

      • setFavorited

        void setFavorited(boolean isFavorited)
        This does not actually favorite the Tweet on Twitter, this function is used in the library.

      • getCreatedAt

        java.util.Calendar getCreatedAt()
        Gets the date and time the tweet was composed.

      • isTruncated

        boolean isTruncated()
        Gets whether or not the Tweet has been truncated.

      • getUrlEntities

        UrlEntity[] getUrlEntities()
        Gets the URL entities contained in the Tweet; URL entities are useful for expanding t.co URLs.

      • getMediaEntities

        MediaEntity[] getMediaEntities()
        Gets the URL entities contained in a Tweet; Media entities are useful for extracting the images held in a tweet.

      • getHashtagEntities

        HashtagEntity[] getHashtagEntities()
        Gets the hashtag entities contained in a Tweet; Hashtag entities are useful for extracting hashtags without using methods like regular expressions.

      • getMentionEntities

        MentionEntity[] getMentionEntities()
        Gets the mention entities contained in a Tweet; Mention entities are useful for extracting mentions without using methods like regular expressions.

      • getUser

        User getUser()
        Gets the User object of the user that created the tweet.

      • getText

        java.lang.String getText()
        Gets the main content contained in the tweet, will be 140 characters or less.

      • getSource

        java.lang.String getSource()
        Gets the application that was used to create the Tweet. Most apps display text like "via source"; for an example, the source could be 'Boid for Android'.

      • getInReplyToStatusId

        long getInReplyToStatusId()
        Gets the ID of the status that this tweet is in reply to (if any).

      • getInReplyToUserId

        long getInReplyToUserId()
        Gets the ID of the user that created the tweet that this tweet is in reply to.

      • getInReplyToScreenName

        java.lang.String getInReplyToScreenName()
        Gets the screen name of the user that created the tweet that this tweet is in reply to.

      • getRetweetCount

        long getRetweetCount()
        Gets the number of times this tweet has been retweeted by other users.

      • isRetweeted

        boolean isRetweeted()
        Gets whether or not the authenticated user has retweeted this tweet.
